subject: Learning
title: Mind Wandering: The Default State
description: A micro-lesson that makes Mind Wandering: The Default State usable.

hook.text: You're reading a book and suddenly realize you've been thinking about dinner for three paragraphs.

buildup.text: Mind wandering occupies roughly 30â€“50% of our waking hours. It's the brain's default state.

discovery.text: The default mode network activates when external focus dropsâ€”it plans, daydreams, and reviews memories.

twist.text: Mind wandering isn't pure waste. It supports creativity, future planning, and self-reflection.

climax.text: The problem is timing. Wandering during a lecture costs learning. Wandering during a walk sparks ideas.

punchline.text: A wandering mind isn't broken. It's just exploring at the wrong time.

quiz.question: What percentage of waking hours does the mind typically wander?
